medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute right lower quadrant pain lasting 12 hours.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began in the umbilical region after a meal yesterday evening, initially thought to be food poisoning. Within 1 hour, the pain intensified, described as feeling 'punched in the abdomen,' specifically in the right lower quadrant. Symptoms included nausea and one episode of vomiting overnight. No fevers, chills, or changes in bowel habits were reported. This pain was new to the patient.
